Sentencas: Solid-oxide iron-air batteries are an emerging technology for large-scale energy storage, but mechanical degradation of Fe-based storage materials limits battery lifetime.
Titulo: Finite Element Model for Coupled Diffusion and Elastoplastic Deformation during High-Temperature Oxidation of Fe to FeO

Sentencas: Experimental studies have revealed cycling degradation due to large volume changes during oxidation/reduction (via H2O/H-2 at 800 degrees C), but degradation has not yet been correlated with the microstructural stress and strain evolution.
Titulo: Finite Element Model for Coupled Diffusion and Elastoplastic Deformation during High-Temperature Oxidation of Fe to FeO

Sentencas: Here, we implement a finite element model for oxidation of a Fe lamella to FeO (74% volumetric expansion), in a lamellar Fe foam designed for battery applications.
Titulo: Finite Element Model for Coupled Diffusion and Elastoplastic Deformation during High-Temperature Oxidation of Fe to FeO

Sentencas: Growth of FeO at the Fe/gas interface is coupled, via an oxidation reaction and solid-state diffusion, with the shrinkage rate of the Fe lamellar core.
Titulo: Finite Element Model for Coupled Diffusion and Elastoplastic Deformation during High-Temperature Oxidation of Fe to FeO

Sentencas: Using isotropic linear elasticity and plastic hardening, the model simulates deformation of a continuously growing FeO layer by dynamically switching gas elements into new FeO elements along a sharp FeO/gas interface.
Titulo: Finite Element Model for Coupled Diffusion and Elastoplastic Deformation during High-Temperature Oxidation of Fe to FeO

Sentencas: As oxidation progresses, the effective plastic strain and von Mises stress increase in FeO. Distribution of tensile and compressive stresses along the Fe/FeO interface are validated by oxidation theory and explain interface delamination, as observed during in operando X-ray tomography experiments.
Titulo: Finite Element Model for Coupled Diffusion and Elastoplastic Deformation during High-Temperature Oxidation of Fe to FeO

Sentencas: The model explains the superior stability of lamellar vs dendritic foam architectures and the improved redox lifetime of Fe-Ni foams.
Titulo: Finite Element Model for Coupled Diffusion and Elastoplastic Deformation during High-Temperature Oxidation of Fe to FeO

Finite Element Model for Coupled Diffusion and Elastoplastic Deformation during High-Temperature Oxidation of Fe to FeO

Sentencas: Published on behalf of The Electrochemical Society by IOP Publishing Limited.
Titulo: Finite Element Model for Coupled Diffusion and Elastoplastic Deformation during High-Temperature Oxidation of Fe to FeO
